note.p: Death: His villa just outside Modena, Italy (20 September or 21 December 1733)
Burial: Church of the Discalzed Carmelites, Modena, Italy

Career: Started a private academy, which met in his home twice a week to discuss literature; travelled to France (1687); entered the service of Cardinal Rinaldo d'Este, later Duke of Modena, at Rome and then in Modena (1694); friend of Francesco Torti (FRS 1717) and Lodovico Antonio Muratori (FRS 1717), who wrote a memoir of his life (1735)
Memberships: Accademia della Crusca; Accademia dell'Arcadia
References: A Rupert Hall, 'Further Newton Correspondence' in NR 1982-83 vol 37 pp 7-34
Notes: Fantuzzi gives date of death as 20 September 1733
